question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
Resolves Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
Donald Trump
Donald Trump Jr.
Eric Trump
Ivanka Trump
Tiffany Trump
Melania Trump
Barron Trump

Q.title: Will Stacey Abrams be elected president in or before the 2040 election?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This resolves positively if Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before 2040 and the result is not overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated. This resolves negatively by any other outcome

P_given_Q.title: Given Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before the 2040 election, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P: This resolves positively if Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before 2040 and the result is not overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated. This resolves negatively by any other outcome.

Resolution Criteria for Q: Resolves Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

Suppose the following is true: Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before the 2040 election. Then, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Stacey Abrams will not be elected president in or before the 2040 election, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Stacey Abrams is not elected president in or before 2040, or the result is overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. Resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
Resolves Yes if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
Donald Trump
Donald Trump Jr.
Eric Trump
Ivanka Trump
Tiffany Trump
Melania Trump
Barron Trump

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria: This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.) 

Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway. 

The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data. 

Additionally, resolves Yes if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for the condition: This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible.

Resolution Criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if none of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No.
If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_given_Q.title: Given that we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. Additionally, it will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that we will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: We will not detect an exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere before January 1, 2030. Then, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before January 1, 2025?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected and the upper tax bracket is increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

question.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, which resolves positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

Then, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050? This question resolves positively if the price of water hits $2500 by January 1, 2050, 00:00 UTC, negatively if it does not, and ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there is less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, which resolves positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

Then, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050? This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. It resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 not hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, which is based on data from NASA. Then, will the price of water on the NQH20 not hit $2,500 (adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? 

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve positively if the price of water does not hit $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water hits $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 not hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. Then, will the price of water on the NQH20 not hit $2,500 (adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? This question will resolve positively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and negatively if it does.
